subConcepts.name: Computer‑Assisted Instruction (1960s-1970s)
subConcepts.description: Early use of computers for drill-and-practice, programmed instruction and tutorial systems.

subConcepts.name: Intelligent Tutoring Systems (1970s-1990s)
subConcepts.description: Rule-based ITS modelling student knowledge and providing adaptive feedback (e.g., SCHOLAR, Cognitive Tutors).

subConcepts.name: Expert Systems & AI research (1980s)
subConcepts.description: Use of expert-system approaches to model domain expertise and support decision-making in education.

subConcepts.name: Multimedia & Computer‑Based Training (1990s)
subConcepts.description: Integration of multimedia, simulations and CBT, enabling richer interactive learning experiences.

subConcepts.name: Adaptive Learning & Personalization (2000s)
subConcepts.description: Systems that adapt content and sequencing to individual learner profiles using algorithms and models.

subConcepts.name: Learning Analytics & Educational Data Mining (2010s)
subConcepts.description: Analysis of learner data to inform design, adaptivity and institutional decision-making.

subConcepts.name: MOOCs & Scalable Online Platforms (2010s)
subConcepts.description: Massive open online courses and platforms that scaled delivery and generated large learning datasets.

subConcepts.name: Automated Assessment & NLP (2000s-2010s)
subConcepts.description: Use of natural language processing for essay scoring, automated feedback and grading assistance.

subConcepts.name: Deep Learning & Large Language Models (2020s‑present)
subConcepts.description: Recent advances in deep learning and LLMs enabling conversational tutors, content generation and complex feedback.

subConcepts.name: Ethics, Policy & Equity (ongoing)
subConcepts.description: Concerns about bias, privacy, academic integrity, regulation and equitable access as AI is adopted in education.
